content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

word

Related words are:

- sentence
- language
- unit

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!

content.thinking:
I need to provide a clue for the target word "word" without using the word itself or any of the related words: "sentence", "language", or "unit".

Let me think of ways to describe "word":
- A collection of letters that has meaning
- Something you speak or write that has a specific meaning
- A basic element of communication
- A string of characters with a defined meaning
- A term or expression

I need to avoid using:
- "word" (the target word)
- "sentence" (related word)
- "language" (related word)
- "unit" (related word)

I should also avoid morphological variants like:
- "words" (plural of target)
- "wording" (variant of target)
- "linguistic" (variant of "language")
- "sentencing" (variant of "sentence")
- "unitary" (variant of "unit")

Here's my clue:
I'll describe a word as "a group of letters that expresses a concept or idea." This avoids all the prohibited terms while clearly pointing to what a word is.

Or more concisely:
"A group of letters with meaning"

Even shorter:
"Letters combined to create meaning"

Since I'm under time pressure, I should keep my description short and to the point, but also clear enough for the player to guess "word".

content.text: CLUE: A group of letters that forms a meaningful expression, like "apple" or "run".

clem_player.response: CLUE: A group of letters that forms a meaningful expression, like "apple" or "run".

content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to guess a target word that another player describes to you.

You can make one guess at each trial. You win when you guess the target word. You lose when you cannot guess it in 3 tries.

After each trial you will get a new hint from the other player which starts with CLUE.

Make your guesses by just saying the word using the following form: GUESS: <a word>

Let us start.


CLUE: A group of letters that forms a meaningful expression, like "apple" or "run".

content.thinking:
The clue is describing a word that is "a group of letters that forms a meaningful expression, like 'apple' or 'run'". This sounds like the definition of the word "word" itself.

A "word" is defined as a unit of language that functions as a principal carrier of meaning, consisting of one or more morphemes that are linked more or less tightly together.

The examples given are "apple" (a noun) and "run" (a verb), which are both words. So I think the target word is "word".

Let me make my first guess.
